name: Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
○ using the correct and complete set of drawings.
○ all drawings are the latest revision.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Record of conformity - Site and Office Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation Permit issued by APAM obtained prior to any excavation on site.
Record of conformity - Proof of permit & ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Details of the proposed precast drainage pits, headwalls, and culverts to be as specified on the IFC Drawings.
○ Approval of the shop drawings constitutes a Hold Point.
○ Outline of sampling and test program
Acceptance Criteria - All Pit covers to conform to AS 3996 and the applicable load class to be as noted on the Drawings. For all drainage pits, pit lids are to be Class D.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
2.3 - Box Culverts Bedding, Side, Overlay and Backfill Zone Materials.
Acceptance Criteria - Materials are to be compliant with the requirements detailed in Cl.16.5.6. Material submission approval.
2.4 - Blinding for Drainage Pits and Headwalls
Acceptance Criteria - Approved bedding material as per IFC Drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Non-woven type complying with the requirements of VicRoads for first stage filter.
Record of conformity - Visual Inspection & Delivery Docket
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure each precast component is inspected upon arrival ensuring:
○ Dimensions are as shown on manufacturer drawings.
○ All blockouts in correct positions and to dimensions.
○ No damage to any precast structure component to the satisfaction of FH Engineer
○ No modifications to the pits are to be made without written approval from manufacturer.
Record of conformity - Order Acceptance Form
4.0 - Drainage Pit, Headwall and Culvert Installation
Frequency - Prior to construction and each lot
Acceptance Criteria - Set out the drainage structures as shown on the Drawings to identify the locations, lengths and levels:
○ All pits, and inlet and outlet structures.
○ Ends of wing walls and headwalls.
○ At outlets and inlets of box culvert structures.
– Setout of each drainage system to constitute a Hold Point.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation to be performed to the minimum depths, widths and batter slopes as shown on the Drawings, regardless of the type of material.
Inspection of completed excavation works to constitute a Hold Point.
○ The shape of the excavation to be as required and the size sufficient to enable construction of the structure.
○ The width of trench to be not less than the exterior width of the culvert plus 400mm, and not greater than that required for satisfactory backfilling.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - 1 x DCP test to be undertaken per drainage structure to confirm ground conditions.

○ Contractor to notify the Contract Administrator of any area of the foundation with inadequate material to support the proposed drainage structure. Inadequate material is deemed to have a bearing pressure less than 130kPa, equivalent to 4 DCP blows per 100mm, as per note 4 on drawing ZULU-BECA-012- DWG-07102.

○ Inadequate foundation material is to be replaced with a layer of coarse crushed aggregate compacted to 95% relative standard compaction to AS1289 Section 5.5.1 over a geotextile Bidim A29 or approved equivalent.
Record of conformity - DCP, Test Results
4.4 - Blinding for Drainage Pits and Headwalls
Acceptance Criteria - Blinding to be installed as per the depths and widths shown on the Drawings.
○ Headwalls: 100mm 15MPa Concrete blinding and 600x150mm apron cut off wall
Reference Documents - IFC Drawings & VicRoads SD
Inspection/Test Method - Verify and Visual Inspection
Record of conformity - Delivery Docket & This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Bedding material to comprise of approved select fill and to be placed for the full width of the trench.
○ Upon completion, the bedding is to provide a uniform firm foundation with the top surface of the bedding shaped to the details shown on the drawings. This to constitute a Witness Point.
Inspection/Test Method - Verify and Visual Inspection
Record of conformity - Delivery Docket & This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Precast structures installed as per survey set out points marked on blinding / bedding layer
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Side Zone, Overlay Zone and Backfill Zone Subject to Vehicle Loads
○ Completed in layers with maximum thickness of Cl200mm loose material.
Overlay and Backfill Zone – Not Subject to Vehicle Loads
○ Ordinary fill material compliant with Cl.16.5.6.3 of Beca’s specification
Inspection/Test Method - Verify and Site Inspection
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
○ "1 test per layer of bedding for bedding materials and every 2nd layer for side, overlay and backfill zone materials."
Acceptance Criteria - Bed Zone – Minimum 90% SMDD
○ Side Zone Not Subject to Vehicle Loads – Minimum RD of 95% SMDD
○ Side Zone Subject to Vehicle Loads – Minimum of 95% SMDD
○ Overlay and Backfill Zone Not Subject to Vehicle Loads – Minimum 90% SMDD
○ Overlay and Backfill Zone Subject to Vehicle Loads – Minimum 95% SMDD
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
